div.p: Bundle 10, no. 12, unit 11, VPRS 1095 special files, VA 466 Governor, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
To proof.
See also M to C. Darling, 28 November 1863. Melbourne, botan. Garden

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
The enclosed letter from your Excellency's predecessor
Letter not found.
I suspect it might be one of the letters from Barkly to M taken from the Govs let er books, but reference to 63-11-28does not identify which one. Letter book might not have an annotation such as this if it was added when the letter sent was signed. I suggest the note become 'Th e specific letter from Barkly to M has not been identified' if it cannot be identified from the p/copies at the Herbarium
being marked private, I could not append to the documents, which I now herewith have the honor to submit. But as the contents of Sir Henrys letter bear directly on the subject, on which I am commanded to report by your Excellency I felt it my duty to submit it for your private perusal. It reveals the unrestrained sentiments of Sir Henry's disapproval of certain stages of the meteorite-proceedings, to which I was obliged to refer; and moreover it will convince your Excellency, that any further communication on my part with the Board will not remove the existing difficulty, but only involve an uneserved humiliation to myself.

If your Excellency deem a conference necessary between myself & the only two members of the Board now here, I would solicit, that such may take place under the Presidency of a Minister of the Crown, and then such interview would afford me the greatest gratification.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I remain your Excellencys very humble
